title: Door Lock Problem
fixes: The washing machine door isn't properly closed, or there's a malfunction with the door lock mechanism. Ensure the door is shut firmly and check for any obstructions preventing a complete closure. A faulty door lock switch or electrical issue with the lock could also be the culprit.

title: Drum Motor Control Error
fixes: A problem has been detected with the control board or motor that regulates the drum's rotation. This could be due to a faulty motor, a malfunctioning control board, or an electrical wiring issue.

title: Communication Error Between Control Boards (on specific models)
fixes: In some Electrolux washers with dual control boards, this code signifies a communication error between them. This could be due to a faulty control board or a loose connection between the boards.

title: Insufficient Water During Washing Stage
fixes: The washer isn't detecting enough water during the washing cycle. Recheck for clogged water inlet issues or a faulty water inlet valve.

title: Water Overflow Error
fixes: The washer has detected an excessive amount of water in the drum, potentially due to a malfunctioning pressure sensor or a faulty inlet valve.

title: Electronic circuit board fault
fixes: This code indicates a problem with the main control board of your washing machine. Possible causes include a faulty component on the board, electrical wiring issues, or water damage.

title: Door open error
fixes: The washing machine door isn't properly closed or there's a malfunction with the door lock mechanism. Ensure the door is shut firmly and check for any obstructions preventing a complete closure. A faulty door lock switch or electrical issue with the lock could also be the culprit.

title: Temperature sensing fault
fixes: The NTC thermistor, which is responsible for measuring water temperature, is malfunctioning. This could be due to a faulty sensor itself, a loose connection between the sensor and the control board, or a problem with the control board.

title: Water filling error
fixes: The washer is unable to fill with water properly during the cycle. Potential causes include a clogged water inlet valve or filter screen, kinked or blocked water supply hose, or low water pressure from the house supply.

title: Waste pipe blockage or pump issue
fixes: There's a blockage in the drain hose or a malfunction with the drain pump. Check the drain hose for any objects lodged within and clear any clogs. A faulty drain pump or an electrical issue with the pump could also be the problem.

title: Door lock fault
fixes: Similar to F02, this code indicates an issue with the door lock mechanism. Check for proper closure and any obstructions. A faulty door lock switch or electrical problem could be the culprit.

title: Heater relay stuck
fixes: The relay that controls the heating element is stuck in the on position, causing the water to overheat. This could be due to a faulty relay itself or an issue with the control board.

title: Heater relay stuck (alternative)
fixes: In some Hotpoint models, F08 might also indicate a stuck heater relay, similar to F07.

title: Setup Error
fixes: This code is less common and might signify an error during the initial setup of the washing machine. Consult your user manual for troubleshooting steps specific to your model.

title: Pressure Switch
fixes: The pressure switch, which monitors water levels in the drum, is malfunctioning. This could be due to a faulty pressure switch itself, a blocked pressure hose, or an issue with the control board.

title: Drain pump
fixes: Similar to F05, this code indicates a problem with the drain pump. Check for clogs in the drain hose and ensure the pump is functioning properly.

title: No communication between control boards
fixes: In some Hotpoint models with dual control boards, this code signifies a communication error between them. This could be due to a faulty control board or a loose connection between the boards.

title: Dryer temperature sensing fault (washer dryers only)
fixes: This code is specific to Hotpoint washer dryers and indicates a problem with the temperature sensor for the drying function. The NTC thermistor responsible for monitoring drying temperature might be faulty.

title: Dryer not heating (washer dryers only)
fixes: Another code specific to washer dryers, F14 indicates the dryer function isn't heating properly. This could be due to a malfunctioning heating element, a faulty temperature sensor, or an issue with the control board.

title: Dryer element relay (washer dryers only)
fixes: Yet another code specific to washer dryers, F15 points towards a problem with the relay controlling the heating element in the drying function. This could be a faulty relay itself or an issue with the control board.

title: Not used (alternative)
fixes: In some models, F16 might not be used.

title: Door lock
fixes: Similar to F02 and F06, this code signifies a problem with the door lock mechanism. Ensure proper closure and check for any obstructions. A faulty door lock switch or electrical issue with the lock could be the culprit.

fixes: This code indicates an error in communication between the control board and a 3-phase motor, which is less common in household washing machines. It suggests a problem with the motor, its connection, or the control board.

fixes: The washer is having difficulty heating the water to the desired temperature. This could be due to a faulty heating element, a malfunctioning NTC thermistor (temperature sensor), or an issue with the control board.

title: Drain Error

title: Drum Unbalance Error
fixes: The laundry load in the drum is unbalanced, causing excessive vibration. Redistribute the laundry items for a more even weight distribution.

fixes: A problem has been detected with the washing machine's motor. This could be due to a faulty motor itself, a malfunctioning motor control board, or an electrical wiring issue.

fixes: There might be a leak in the drain hose or a problem with the way the hose is positioned. Check for any leaks or damage to the hose and ensure it's properly secured to the drain outlet.

fixes: The washer is unable to fill with water properly during the cycle. Potential causes include a clogged water inlet valve or filter screen, kinked or blocked water supply hose, or low water pressure from the house supply.

title: Drain Error
fixes: The washer is unable to drain the water properly during the cycle. A clogged drain hose, blocked drain pump, or faulty drain pump could be the culprit.

title: Water Level Pressure Sensor Fault
fixes: The pressure sensor, which monitors water levels in the drum, is malfunctioning. This could be due to a faulty pressure switch itself, a blocked pressure hose, or an issue with the control board.

title: Water Overflow Error
fixes: The washer has detected an excessive amount of water in the drum, potentially due to a malfunctioning pressure sensor or a faulty inlet valve.

title: Water Heating Error
fixes: The washer is having difficulty heating the water to the desired temperature. This could be due to a faulty heating element, a malfunctioning NTC thermistor (temperature sensor), or an issue with the control board.

title: Unbalanced Load Error
fixes: The laundry load in the drum is unbalanced, causing excessive vibration. Redistribute the laundry items for a more even weight distribution.

title: Current Error
fixes: The washer has detected a surge in electrical current. This could be due to a power surge or a problem with the motor or control board.

title: Motor Overload Error
fixes: The motor is overloaded, likely due to an excessively heavy load. Reduce the amount of laundry in the drum and restart the cycle.

title: Child Lock Activated
fixes: The child lock function is engaged on the control panel, disabling certain buttons.

title: Motor Error or PCB Error
fixes: This code indicates a potential issue with the motor itself or the main control board (PCB). This could be due to a malfunctioning motor, a faulty control board, or an electrical wiring issue.

title: Water Level Sensor Error
fixes: The water level sensor is malfunctioning or has a faulty connection. Check the sensor wiring and connections, or replace the sensor if necessary.

title: Overcurrent Error
fixes: The motor is drawing too much current, indicating a potential motor or control board issue. Unplug the unit and contact a technician for motor inspection.

title: Power Supply Error
fixes: There is an issue with the electrical power supply to the washer. Check the power cord connection and verify proper voltage at the outlet.

title: Communication Error
fixes: The main control board cannot communicate with other components. Reset the washer by unplugging for 5 minutes, or check internal wiring connections.

title: Motor Relay Error
fixes: The motor relay on the control board has failed or stuck. This typically requires replacement of the main control board.

title: Water Temperature Error
fixes: The water temperature is too high, exceeding 122°F (50°C). Check the hot water supply temperature and ensure cold water is also connected.

title: Door Lock Error
fixes: The door is not locking properly or the lock mechanism has failed. Ensure the door is fully closed and check for obstructions in the door latch.

title: Fan Error
fixes: The cooling fan is not operating correctly. Check for obstructions and verify the fan motor is receiving power.

title: Water Leak Error
fixes: A water leak has been detected in the base of the washer. Check all hose connections and inspect the door seal for damage.

title: Stuck Key Error
fixes: A button on the control panel is stuck or continuously pressed. Clean the control panel and check for stuck buttons.

title: Motor Overload
fixes: The motor is overloaded or overheating. Reduce the load size and ensure proper ventilation around the washer.

title: Door Lock Failure
fixes: The door lock mechanism has completely failed. Replace the door lock assembly to restore function.

title: No Drain
fixes: The washer is unable to drain water from the tub. Check the drain pump and hose for blockages.

title: Water Fill Failure
fixes: The washer cannot fill with water. Verify water supply is on and inlet filters are clean.

title: No Water Detected
fixes: The washer is not detecting water entering the tub. Check water supply valves, inlet screens, and the pressure switch.

title: Long Drain
fixes: The drain cycle is taking longer than expected. Clean the drain pump filter and check for restrictions in the drain system.

title: Door Lock Error
fixes: The door will not lock or unlock properly. Inspect the door lock mechanism and wiring for faults.

title: Heater Error
fixes: The water heater is not reaching the target temperature. Test the heating element and replace if defective.

title: Temperature Sensor Error
fixes: The water temperature sensor is reading out of range. Check the thermistor connections and resistance values.

title: Door Switch Error
fixes: The door switch is not detecting the door position correctly. Clean the door switch contacts or replace the switch.

title: Overflow Error
fixes: The pressure switch indicates an overflow condition. Check for a stuck pressure switch or faulty water inlet valve.

title: Serial Communication Failure

title: Door Unlock Error

title: MCU Failure

title: Limit Circuit Lockout
fixes: ⚠️ SAFETY: Turn off power before inspection. The limit switch has opened 3 times, indicating overheating. Check for blocked air filters, closed supply vents, or a faulty blower motor on your Carrier furnace.

title: Ignition Lockout
fixes: ⚠️ GAS SAFETY: The igniter failed to light the gas after multiple attempts. Verify gas supply is on, check the Carrier igniter for cracks, and ensure proper flame sensor operation.

title: Rollout Switch Open
fixes: ⚠️ DANGER: This indicates flames are escaping the combustion chamber. Immediately turn off the Carrier furnace and call a licensed HVAC technician - this is a serious safety hazard.

title: Pressure Switch Stuck Closed
fixes: The pressure switch is closed when it should be open. Check for a stuck Carrier pressure switch or debris in the pressure tubing.

title: Pressure Switch Stuck Open
fixes: The inducer motor is running but the pressure switch won't close. Inspect the Carrier pressure switch hose for blockages or leaks, and verify proper inducer motor operation.

title: Pressure Switch Open
fixes: The pressure switch failed to close during startup. Check the Carrier inducer motor, pressure switch tubing, and vent system for blockages or restrictions.

title: Limit Switch Open
fixes: ⚠️ OVERHEATING: The high limit switch has opened due to excessive heat. Check your Carrier furnace air filter, ensure all supply registers are open, and verify blower motor operation.

title: Blower Motor Off Delay
fixes: The blower continues running after the heating cycle. This is normal operation on Carrier furnaces to extract residual heat, but if excessive, check the blower control settings.

title: Flame Sense Error
fixes: The flame sensor is not detecting flame properly. Clean the Carrier flame sensor rod with fine steel wool and verify proper grounding of the furnace.

title: Furnace Lockout
fixes: The furnace has locked out after multiple ignition failures. Reset by turning off power for 30 seconds. If problem persists, check gas supply and Carrier ignition components.

title: Low Flame Signal
fixes: Weak flame detection signal. Clean the Carrier flame sensor, check gas pressure (should be 3.5" WC for natural gas), and inspect burner flames for proper blue color.

title: Pressure Switch Stuck Closed
fixes: The pressure switch is closed when the inducer is off. Check the Trane pressure switch for proper operation and inspect for stuck contacts.

title: Pressure Switch Open

title: Keypad Error
fixes: The keypad has failed. Replace the Maytag control panel assembly.

title: Keypad Stuck
fixes: A key is stuck on the keypad. Clean or replace the Maytag control panel.

title: Oven Temperature Sensor Error
fixes: The oven sensor has failed. Replace the Maytag temperature sensor probe.

title: Oven Sensor Shorted
fixes: The oven sensor is shorted. Replace the Maytag oven sensor.

title: Oven Relay Error
fixes: An oven relay has failed. Replace the Maytag relay on the control board.

title: Door Latch Error
fixes: The door latch mechanism has failed. Replace the Maytag door lock assembly.

title: Door Lock Motor Error
fixes: The door lock motor has failed. Replace the Maytag door lock motor.

title: Cooling Fan Error
fixes: The cooling fan has failed. Replace the Maytag cooling fan motor.

title: Heating Element Error
fixes: A heating element has failed. Test and replace the faulty Maytag heating element.

title: Oven Overheating
fixes: ⚠️ OVERHEATING: The oven has exceeded safe temperature. Turn off the Maytag oven and check the temperature sensor.

title: Oven Door Unlatch Error
fixes: The door will not unlatch. Manually release the Maytag door lock and check the mechanism.

title: Control Board Communication Error
fixes: The control boards cannot communicate. Check all Maytag wire connections.

title: Unbalanced Load
fixes: The load is unbalanced. Redistribute laundry evenly in the Maytag washer.

title: Hot and Cold Reversed
fixes: ⚠️ PLUMBING: The hot and cold water lines are reversed. Correct the Maytag water connections.

title: Control Board Error
fixes: The control board has failed. Replace the Whirlpool dishwasher control board.

fixes: The keypad has failed. Replace the Whirlpool control panel.

fixes: The heating element has failed. Replace the Whirlpool heating element.

title: Vent Wax Motor Error
